rsbNotes.title: Acts 13:20
rsbNotes.text: 13:20 about 450 years. About four hundred years plus the forty years in the wilderness and the period of Joshua’s conquest (7:6 note).

rsbNotes.title: Acts 13:33
rsbNotes.text: 13:33 You are my Son, today I have begotten you. That is, today in raising You from the dead, I am declaring that You are My Son and I am Your Father (Heb. 1:5 note).

rsbNotes.title: Acts 13:34
rsbNotes.text: 13:34 no more to return to corruption. That is, never to die again.

rsbNotes.title: Acts 13:39
rsbNotes.text: 13:39 The law points the sinner to Christ (Gal. 3:24), for “a person is not justified by works of the law but through faith in Jesus Christ” (Gal. 2:16). To be justified is to be declared righteous by God (Rom. 3:21, 22), and therefore granted forgiveness of sins (Eph. 1:7). See “Justification and Merit” at Gal. 3:11.
